Row.Text: Stores [ICON_FOOD] Food when a new [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born, equal to the city's [ICON_PEACE] Faith output (up to 15%). Does not require a Shrine to be built.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_RES_INCENSE] Incense and [ICON_RES_WINE] Wine. Reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Religious Unrest.
Niels Trolle til Trollesholm og Gavnø

Our people are now enjoying your fishing rights and banging their heads to your black metal. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture, and that it shall foil any hope we have in creating a one world government.

These worshippers of false Gods infect the land like a plague with their witchery and superstitution. If we are to truly become a nation favoured by God, we must convert them by sword or prayer, whatever it takes.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Norway [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must have a {1_ReligionType} [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]All citizens following your pantheon belief are converted to your {1_ReligionType} [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Num} {4_Yield} [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Note: The [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost increases with every citizen in the empire following only your pantheon belief[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Note: The amount of {4_Yield} received increases with every citizen in the empire following only your pantheon belief[ENDCOLOR]
{1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} has purged his realm of pagan worshippers.

Our ancestors were great seafarers, braving the treacherous oceans in pursuit of wealth and adventure. We should recreate their legendary tales and prepare a great fleet for a voyage into foreign waters, where riches and glory await.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Norway [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must have researched Optics [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted before the Renaissance Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per era [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive two Longboats and one Settler that may cross oceans immediately

Our ancestors were great seafarers, braving the treacherous oceans in pursuit of wealth and adventure. We should recreate their legendary tales and prepare a great fleet for a voyage into foreign waters, where riches and glory await.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receive two Longboats and one Settler that may cross oceans immediately
A great fleet has been commissioned by {1_LeaderName} of {2_CivName} in a quest to discover new lands.

In the city of {1_City}, sore thumbs have become a thing of the past when cutting cheese. Thor Bjørklund has invented what he calls the Cheese Slicer - a product that will no doubt become a household item.

The rebel Bagler group, advocating for the rights of the nobility over those of the common folk, have rallied their support behind a new pretender to the throne of Norway. A civil war has broken out, and the Bagler seek to have us displaced.[NEWLINE]
Their rebellion must be put down.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]3 rebel Swordsmen spawn in your territory[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]2 Birkebeiner spawn in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]
Civil war begins as the Bagler rebels rise up against our rule.
Civil war has broken out in {1_CivName} between claimants to the throne of {2_LeaderName}.

Norway has become a bastion of faith; united in the spirit of devotion to {1_ReligionName}. This confers an inviolable legitimacy upon our throne, and as such, we shall henceforth be known as her Eternal King.[NEWLINE]
We have become known as Haakon Haakonsson the Holy; the Eternal King of Norway.
Norway's Haakon IV has been declared Rex Perpetuus Norvegiae - the Eternal King.
